property.name: codeGenerator
property.doc: Type of code generator to run.

property.name: directory
property.doc: Directory into which to put generated code.

property.name: compileOptions
property.doc: Options to pass to the compiler.

property.name: runOptions
property.doc: Options to use when executing the code.

property.name: packageName
property.doc: Package name for the generated classes.

svg.text: This model is a refined model from the heterogeneous Electronic Throttle Controller model constructed by the UC Berkeley Vehicle Dynamics Lab. The original model was constructed with Simulink and Stateflow by Paul Griffiths, Christoph Kirsch, Tunc Simsek, and Jason Souder.

The discrete-time controller consists of two abstract parts. The first is the controller itself which is a sampled modal sliding-mode controller and the second is the drivers for the pulse-width modulated (pwm) actuators.

The manager decides the operation modes of the ETC:
1=driver mode (tracks the accelerator pedal) 2=limp home mode (limits the accelerator)
This director ensures that this composite is treated by the Giotto domain as an atomic actor, and therefore is implemented in a single Giotto task.
pwm_signal is 1.0 or 0.0 meaning respectively pwm is on or off.
The interface between the discrete-time controller and the continuous-time systems. The actuator values are interpolated using zero-order-hold.
The interface between the continuous-time systems and the discrete-time controller. The sensors are assumed to be sampled periodically with period "samplePeriod".

entity.name: sensor error 1
entity.doc: Create a sequence of uniformly distributed random numbers

entity.name: sensor error 2
entity.doc: Create a sequence of uniformly distributed random numbers

svg.text: The dynamics of the mechanical throttle body modeled as a second order system with forced spring pull-back.

The ETC has several modes of operation including those, such as rev-limiting, that depend on the powertrain parameters. These modes are currently not implemented and the powertrain inputs are put here as a placeholder.
The accelerator_position models the actual position of the accelerator pedal in radians. Zero means the pedal is not depressed and pi means full throttle.
The "driverInput" is a parameter defined at the top level of this model.
